prompt:
Nurse: That's great to hear, Mr. O'Leary. It's critical to have a plan for after your procedure. Now, I need to ask if you've arranged for a ride home and for someone to stay with you after the procedure. Have you been able to arrange that?

Patient: Yes. I have.

Nurse: That's excellent, Mr. O'Leary. It's critical to have someone to assist you after the procedure. If there's anything else you need to discuss or any other questions you have, feel free to ask. [

Patient: [NO RESPONSE]

Nurse: I'm here to help, Mr. O'Leary. If you have any other questions or concerns, please feel free to share. [

Patient: No. I think I'm fine.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. O'Leary. I'm glad to hear that you're feeling prepared. Just to summarize, before your procedure, remember to use the chlorhexidine scrub the night before and the morning of your procedure. Also, do not eat or drink anything after midnight before your procedure. After your procedure, you'll need to follow your doctor's instructions and take your medications as prescribed. Can I count on you to do all of this?

Patient: Yes.

responses.gpt4: That's great to hear, Mr. O'Leary. Remember, I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions, you can call me back at any time at 641-381-6523. Now, I would like to thank you for your time. I can tell from our conversation that your determination to get better is strong, and that's going to serve you well during your recovery. Good luck with your procedure and remember to keep focusing on that balanced diet we discussed. Do you have any final questions for me?
